headline: A Guide to Taking a Sunrise Boat Ride on the Ganges
description: A complete guide to taking a sunrise boat ride on the Ganges in Varanasi. Learn how to book, what to expect, and tips for a memorable experience.

mainEntity.name: What is the best time for a boat ride in Varanasi?

acceptedAnswer.text: The best time for a boat ride is during sunrise (around 5:00-6:00 AM) when the ghats are bathed in golden light and morning rituals are underway. The evening, during the Ganga Aarti, is another popular time.

mainEntity.name: How long does the sunrise boat tour last?

acceptedAnswer.text: A typical sunrise boat tour lasts for about 1 to 2 hours, covering the stretch of ghats from Assi Ghat to Manikarnika Ghat and back.

mainEntity.name: Can I book a private boat?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can book a private boat for a more personal experience. The cost for a private boat typically ranges from ₹500 to ₹1000, while shared boats are cheaper at around ₹100-₹200 per person.

mainEntity.name: Which ghat is best to start the boat ride from?

acceptedAnswer.text: Most sunrise boat rides start from either Assi Ghat or Dashashwamedh Ghat. Both are easily accessible and have many boatmen available in the early morning.
